title: 107_hr1352
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. CODIFICATION AND MODIFICATION OF PERMANENT PROVISION RELATING TO BUY AMERICAN REQUIREMENTS." is a condensed summary of a section related to Buy American requirements. Requirement to buy certain articles from American sources; exceptions. Funds for Department of Defense cannot be used for procurement of items not made in the US, including food, clothing, tents, cotton products. The requirement to buy certain articles from American sources includes specialty metals, hand or measuring tools, and individual equipment made from specific fibers, yarns, fabrics, or materials. The Secretary of Defense can waive this requirement if satisfactory quality and quantity of the item are not available. The Secretary of Defense can waive the requirement to buy certain articles from American sources if the quality and quantity needed are not available in the United States at market prices. This waiver requires notification to specific committees and a 30-day waiting period. Certain procurements outside the United States, such as those in support of combat operations or by vessels in foreign waters, are exempt from this requirement. Emergency or perishable procurements are also exceptions. Emergency procurements or perishable foods by establishments outside the US for personnel attached to such establishments are exempt. Specialty metals or chemical warfare protective clothing can be procured from foreign sources if necessary for offsetting sales made by the US Government or in furtherance of agreements with foreign governments. In furtherance of agreements with foreign governments, purchases of supplies or services can be made from the other country. Certain exceptions apply, such as procurement of foods manufactured in the US and purchases below a certain threshold. This applies to contracts and subcontracts for procurement. This section applies to contracts and subcontracts for the procurement of commercial items, regardless of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act. The term 'United States' includes commonwealths, territories, and possessions. Repeal of source provisions related to buying certain articles from American sources under Department of Defense Appropriations Acts of 1993 and 1997.
